dialogue.text: If you're into the underground music scene here in Enzync City, then Sour needs no introduction.
He's one of my absolute favorite EDM musicians! I've got all his albums saved on my phone!
Y'know, I've been thinking... It feels wrong that people still call him the 'Underground' EDM Star.
Sour's reaching mainstream success now. If these records I'm finding are accurate, he's got thousands of listeners all around the world, and even more so after his team up with Sweet.
That doesn't feel so underground to me; he's basically a celebrity!
That's true, though he hasn't left his underground roots behind. He doesn't want the fame to take him away from what built him up in the first place.
That's what I find most admirable about him. He never leaves anyone behind, and wants everyone to just have a good time.
His mother was a megastar, too. That absolutely set him up to be this successful right from the get-go. Makes me question this whole underground thing even more.
Hey, what gives, Syn? Do you have something against Sour?
Nah, I'm just a stickler for semantics.
I could loop his tracks all day. As an electronic myself, I deeply appreciate the Electronic Dance genre.
Even if... y'know... I can't actually dance. Though I'm content on enjoying it vicariously through watching Sunny dance to it in her room.
I've covered Sour extensively in my blog, though is there anything else fun you can find about him?
Well... did you know that he's been wearing a hat this whole time, and that his hair isn't actually green?
